result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E Kusba

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:06 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant James E Kusba in court.  Attorney John Zich in court for James E Kusba.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter by Zoom.  Deputy Travis Krueger, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  State rests.  Defense calls no witnesses.  Defense is not contesting bind over.  Court finds probable cause, binds case over for filing of information.  Information filed, copy to Def.'s Atty.  Def.'s Atty. has copy, waives reading, enters not guilty plea to all three counts.  Court receives not guilty pleas and directs clerk to enter into the record.  Def. does not have to appear for St. Conf. and advised to keep address current.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:42 PM Defendant James E Kusba in court with attorney John Zich, via zoom.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Atty Zich has copy of complaint, waives reading, reserve rights and set for timely p.h.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 02:40 PM Defendant James E Kusba in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews history of case and reviews case status report.  Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:45 PM Defendant James E Kusba in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews history of case. Status of Counsel report. Def. will continue to wait. Court heard on preliminary examination and def. is allowed to have counsel.  Court finds for good cause and will continue to allow attorney appointed. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Waiting for bond from Kenosha per Lang. Co. Jail

With conditions no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, maintain absolute sobriety, no use of alcohol or presence in taverns, and no driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

01:18 PM Defendant James E Kusba in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James E Kusba appeared by video means. All parties via Zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty.  Defendant makes statement to charges.  ADA makes argument and makes a recommendation to a $5,000 cash bond.  With conditions of no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, maintain absolute sobriety, no use of alcohol or presence in taverns, and no driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant makes response.  Court makes ruling.  Court grants ADA request of a $5,000 cash bond with conditions no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, maintain absolute sobriety, no use of alcohol or presence in taverns, and no driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court is adjourned. Adjourned Initial Appearance is scheduled for April 11th, 2022 at 01:30 am.
